item.title: Two Voi e-bikes dumped in Hatherley Brook under Robert Burns Avenue bridge, 15th July
item.description:
To looks like two Voi bikes have been thrown off the Robert Burns Avenue bridge into Hatherly Brook and are currently lying on the bank of the brook.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Robert Burns Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole on left hand side, towards Hucclecote, on the camber, just after the crown of the hill., 15th July
item.description:
Pothole on left hand side, towards Hucclecote, on the camber, just after the crown of the hill. There is a case logged here referring to "near BS Honey", so this might be the same one, but it's very much on the slant of the camber on the left. Could it be checked and ideally filled please ? Thankyou !
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ADE63 - stile completely overgrown, 15th July
item.description:
Where ADE63 meets the farm track (North-West side) the stile is virtually impossible to see and is completely overgrown and impassable.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wick Lane, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The road surface is dangerous, 15th July
item.description:
Photo of this report ///pacemaker.trader.classmate Coming down Cleeve Hill on the B4362, kits before the last lay-by before Postlip, have added photo from google earth to show the spot but the road surface is sinking into the road, the whole area has been resurfaced and worked on before but its deteriorating rapidly. I see someone reported a pothole in this area previously and I didn‚Äôt report its last time because of this buts its worsened since i last went that way, its more than a pothole. It‚Äôs a real hazard, it‚Äôs on a bend and you don‚Äôt notice it until you are going through it. It‚Äôs a series of bumps and dips. There is a sign along the road but if it‚Äôs for this then it‚Äôs too far away. This needs action immediately, even if that‚Äôs just better signage before someone looses control of a vehicle or a cyclist comes of a bike. Whatever you filled it did before has not resolved this issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: [Portable loo] left Behind!!!, 15th July
item.description:
The [portable loo] has been left on the Island opposite a residents house for the last week. If it belongs to the workmen who were working in Butts Lane please arrange for it to be collected asap. If it belongs to the builders working on No 12A it would be nice to have it moved asap from public land. Residents would appreciate the long grass is cut to restore a sense of pride in the area, as it is looking a mess. Thanks üôè
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bushcombe Close, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Signs & Barriers left behind by Contractor

item.title: Traffic light on A40 towards Cheltenham facing wrong way resulting in confusion for bourton road traffic, 15th July
item.description:
Lights at andoversford village on the A40 have twisted from facing traffic travelling towards Cheltenham to face traffic coming from bourton direction. Not sure how long this has been an issue. What three words: molars.cats.whirlpool
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Andoversford Bypass, Andoversford, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Sinkhole, 15th July
item.description:
Outside number 4 Millham Road, Bishops Cleeve next to the street light. If it gets any bigger it could block our driveway and also be very dangerous for pedestrians. I noticed about a week ago Kind Regards

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4,6, Millham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: No right turn priority, 15th July
item.description:
When heading south-west bound on the B4063 Cheltenham Road, the traffic lights at Old Cheltenham Road have no right turn priority. The traffic lights appear to be set up for this i.e. there is a slot for a right turn priority light, however this never gets used. This causes tailbacks on the B4063 as right turning traffic gets blocks by Northbound traffic. Please enable the right turn priority light.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croft Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham

item.title: Water does not run away. It just pulls in one place and does not go towards the Drain., 15th July
item.description:
Water pools in this one spot right next to pedestrian crossing and catches pedestrians when they walk around the corner and get splashed very considerably due to the depth of the water the water does not run towards the drain. It runs away from the drain and also when it is dry, the road is cracked

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Hewlett Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
